channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large tree with partially severed branch, 6th October
item.description:
Tree affecting fence/garden of 31 The Holt. Accessed via Grangefield School car park. Elderly resident states the tree is over 18 foot high, swaying precariously and she believes it is unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grangefield Approach, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights out, 6th October
item.description:
Traffic lights out & a roundabout has appeared. This is causing traffic chaos.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Narrowing of junction causing unforeseen issues, 6th October
item.description:
The narrowing of the northbound lane of the Evesham Road at the junction of the Evesham Road and Wellington Road is causing extremely long traffic jams - when a car in this lane wants to turn right it causes a huge tail back as drivers seeking to turn right seem incapable or moving forward and positioning themselves towards the right to let cars seeking to go straight on past. Unfortunately they seem to hang back and since the road as been narrowed to increased the pavement width at the new junction layout now cars cannot get past. I regularly have to wait for multiple light changes to move just 2 car lengths which seems absolutely ridiculous - all because people do not know how to drive and position their vehicle correctly to turn right! Perhaps some road markings to indicate that a car wishing to turn right should move forward and keep to the right of the lane so as not to block cars seeking to go straight on? This really is causing ridiculous and unnecessary hold ups!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Ash tree at storm risk, 6th October
item.description:
There is a very large Ash tree alongside a Gas Sub station. It is ajacent to to Pickwick and 42 New Barn Close. Both properties occupied by Senior Citizens. Should the tree suffer serious storm damage, the Gas Substation could be dangerously affected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, New Barn Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: 12 inch pothole on Hannah Close, 6th October
item.description:
18 metres from junction with Mottershead Drive by the parking space on the south side of the road. It's quite large and as deep as a golf ball. There's another slightly shallower one adjacent to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hannah Place, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
